result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears by Atty James Fields-Bowers. No appearance by DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1126 - Atty Fields-Bowers has no info as to DE's non-appearance. ST requests BWAR, though no objection to a stay is given. Court orders BWAR with $4500 cash bond. Bond on deposit is forfeited. ALL ORDERS STAYED 1 WEEK to 5/19/16.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  904 - DE is paying restitution - estimated completion by mid-May.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1119 - DE requests adjournment for possible resolution. Restitution payments are being made. STC to be held.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:   924 - Matter heard with 15CM594 (co-def).   Victim rights compliance. Atty Fields-Bowers was just appointed to this case for Atty Lassiter, and requests an adjournment - granted.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
For Restitution Order - filed by ADA J Zapf.  - Joint and severall with Elliott T Gary

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Restitution has been determined; def. requests an adjournment to allow time for her to pay.  Status conf. 1/8/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:13pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter heard with co-defendant's case.  Attorney Lassiter is requesting an adjournment to allow the State time to look into restitution issues.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to October 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:06am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Lassiter is requesting an adjournment to allow the DE time to pay restitution.  Restitution requested is $517.75.  Discussion held re: whether the DE stipulates to the restitution amount.  Court adjourns matter to allow parties to look into the requested restitution amount.  Final pre-trial adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Matter will be heard with the co-defendant's case at the next hearing.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

2:02  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. PTC 5-22-15 @ 2:10 pm, FPT 7-23-15 @ 9:30 am  $4500.00 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*No Contact w/ Sam's Club @ 3300 Brumback Blvd  Elliot G or his residence
